        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1115628: Security: Full CSP bypass through blob: URIs
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1115628: Security: Full CSP bypass through blob: URIs
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      gink...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1738256893" title="gink...@gmail.com"><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      gink...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>
    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<!----></span><br><br>As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<span class="line"><!---->As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<!----></span><br><br>Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <span class="line"><!---->Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>There are two origins involved in this PoC.<span class="line"><!---->There are two origins involved in this PoC.<!----></span><br>  attacker origin: <span class="line"><!---->  attacker origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a><br>  victim origin: <span class="line"><!---->  victim origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<!----></a><br><br>All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<span class="line"><!---->All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<!----></span><br><br>There is also a secret value located at <span class="line"><!---->There is also a secret value located at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<span class="line"><!----> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<!----></span><br><br>Therefore, if you visit <span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if you visit <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<!----></a> an error should appear in the console.<span class="line"><!----> an error should appear in the console.<!----></span><br><br><br>However, if you visit the attacker page at <span class="line"><!---->However, if you visit the attacker page at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the secret value should appear in an alert().<span class="line"><!----> the secret value should appear in an alert().<!----></span><br><br>Analysis:<span class="line"><!---->Analysis:<!----></span><br>* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<span class="line"><!---->* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<!----></span><br>  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<!----></span><br>* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<span class="line"><!---->* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<!----></span><br><br>The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<span class="line"><!---->The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

            Issue 1115628: Security: Full CSP bypass through blob: URIs
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      gink...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1738256893" title="gink...@gmail.com"><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      gink...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on 
      Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)

    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<!----></span><br><br>As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<span class="line"><!---->As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<!----></span><br><br>Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <span class="line"><!---->Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>There are two origins involved in this PoC.<span class="line"><!---->There are two origins involved in this PoC.<!----></span><br>  attacker origin: <span class="line"><!---->  attacker origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a><br>  victim origin: <span class="line"><!---->  victim origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<!----></a><br><br>All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<span class="line"><!---->All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<!----></span><br><br>There is also a secret value located at <span class="line"><!---->There is also a secret value located at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<span class="line"><!----> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<!----></span><br><br>Therefore, if you visit <span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if you visit <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<!----></a> an error should appear in the console.<span class="line"><!----> an error should appear in the console.<!----></span><br><br><br>However, if you visit the attacker page at <span class="line"><!---->However, if you visit the attacker page at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the secret value should appear in an alert().<span class="line"><!----> the secret value should appear in an alert().<!----></span><br><br>Analysis:<span class="line"><!---->Analysis:<!----></span><br>* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<span class="line"><!---->* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<!----></span><br>  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<!----></span><br>* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<span class="line"><!---->* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<!----></span><br><br>The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<span class="line"><!---->The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1115628: Security: Full CSP bypass through blob: URIs
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1115628: Security: Full CSP bypass through blob: URIs
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      gink...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1738256893" title="gink...@gmail.com"><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      gink...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->gink...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Aug 12, 2020, 2:47 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<!----></span><br><br>As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<span class="line"><!---->As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<!----></span><br><br>Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <span class="line"><!---->Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>There are two origins involved in this PoC.<span class="line"><!---->There are two origins involved in this PoC.<!----></span><br>  attacker origin: <span class="line"><!---->  attacker origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a><br>  victim origin: <span class="line"><!---->  victim origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<!----></a><br><br>All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<span class="line"><!---->All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<!----></span><br><br>There is also a secret value located at <span class="line"><!---->There is also a secret value located at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<span class="line"><!----> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<!----></span><br><br>Therefore, if you visit <span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if you visit <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<!----></a> an error should appear in the console.<span class="line"><!----> an error should appear in the console.<!----></span><br><br><br>However, if you visit the attacker page at <span class="line"><!---->However, if you visit the attacker page at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the secret value should appear in an alert().<span class="line"><!----> the secret value should appear in an alert().<!----></span><br><br>Analysis:<span class="line"><!---->Analysis:<!----></span><br>* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<span class="line"><!---->* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<!----></span><br>  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<!----></span><br>* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<span class="line"><!---->* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<!----></span><br><br>The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<span class="line"><!---->The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        arthursonzogni: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->arthursonzogni: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 15 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         pmeuleman@ and antoniosartori@ are going to improve how a given policy, like<span class="line"><!---->pmeuleman@ and antoniosartori@ are going to improve how a given policy, like<!----></span><br>CSP, are inherited across documents/navigations.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<!----></span><br><br>As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<span class="line"><!---->As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<!----></span><br><br>Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <span class="line"><!---->Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>There are two origins involved in this PoC.<span class="line"><!---->There are two origins involved in this PoC.<!----></span><br>  attacker origin: <span class="line"><!---->  attacker origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a><br>  victim origin: <span class="line"><!---->  victim origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<!----></a><br><br>All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<span class="line"><!---->All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<!----></span><br><br>There is also a secret value located at <span class="line"><!---->There is also a secret value located at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<span class="line"><!----> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<!----></span><br><br>Therefore, if you visit <span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if you visit <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<!----></a> an error should appear in the console.<span class="line"><!----> an error should appear in the console.<!----></span><br><br><br>However, if you visit the attacker page at <span class="line"><!---->However, if you visit the attacker page at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the secret value should appear in an alert().<span class="line"><!----> the secret value should appear in an alert().<!----></span><br><br>Analysis:<span class="line"><!---->Analysis:<!----></span><br>* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<span class="line"><!---->* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<!----></span><br>  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<!----></span><br>* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<span class="line"><!---->* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<!----></span><br><br>The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<span class="line"><!---->The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mkwst: This seems eerily similar to <span class="line"><!---->mkwst: This seems eerily similar to <!----></span>issue 1115298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1115298" title="Full CSP bypass by opening a blob URL in a new tab and reloading it with history.back"><!---->issue 1115298<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>so assigning it to you.<span class="line"><!---->so assigning it to you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by gink...@gmail.com (Aug 12, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<span class="line"><!---->Chrome does not properly inherit a CSP through blob URIs even though they share the same origin as the context thats creates them.<!----></span><br><br>As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<span class="line"><!---->As long as an attacker can execute JavaScript on a victim page, this allows CSP to be entirely bypassed by creating a blob URI and assigning it to the top frame's location.<!----></span><br><br>Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <span class="line"><!---->Note that this vulnerability is not present in Firefox because it treats blob URIs similarly to about:blank. As far as I can tell, the spec is unclear about this: <!----></span>https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL"><!---->https://w3c.github.io/FileAPI/#originOfBlobURL<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 84.0.4147.105 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 OS Version 1903 (Build 18362.959)<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is also present in Chrome canary 86.0.4231.0.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>There are two origins involved in this PoC.<span class="line"><!---->There are two origins involved in this PoC.<!----></span><br>  attacker origin: <span class="line"><!---->  attacker origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a><br>  victim origin: <span class="line"><!---->  victim origin: <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app<!----></a><br><br>All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<span class="line"><!---->All paths on the victim origin have a CSP of: default-src 'none'; script-src 'unsafe-inline'<!----></span><br><br>There is also a secret value located at <span class="line"><!---->There is also a secret value located at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/secret<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<span class="line"><!----> Because of CSP, the victim origin is normally not able to fetch() the secret.<!----></span><br><br>Therefore, if you visit <span class="line"><!---->Therefore, if you visit <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-victim.netlify.app/blocked<!----></a> an error should appear in the console.<span class="line"><!----> an error should appear in the console.<!----></span><br><br><br>However, if you visit the attacker page at <span class="line"><!---->However, if you visit the attacker page at <!----></span>https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue"><!---->https://cgpq29r51wfnl2zd-attacker.okay.blue<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> the secret value should appear in an alert().<span class="line"><!----> the secret value should appear in an alert().<!----></span><br><br>Analysis:<span class="line"><!---->Analysis:<!----></span><br>* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<span class="line"><!---->* The attacker page first loads the victim page in an iframe.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then uses URL.createObjectURL to create a blob URI containing HTML which fetches /secret.<!----></span><br>* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->* The victim page then assigns the blob URI to parent.location. This replaces the parent attacker page, allowing the contents of the blob URI to execute without any CSP restrictions.<!----></span><br>  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<span class="line"><!---->  * Note that sandbox="allow-top-navigation" is used on the attacker page so the victim page can set the top frame's location without any user interaction.<!----></span><br>* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<span class="line"><!---->* The contents of /secret are then displayed in an alert(). They could also easily be sent to the attacker's server.<!----></span><br><br>The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<span class="line"><!---->The attacker page, the victim page, the secret page, and the blocked page are attached.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Philip Papurt<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to beta. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M89. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<span class="line"><!---->This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to beta.         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

      <chops-dialog closeonoutsideclick="">

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        </h3>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
